texts.definition: Goals that are shared by two or more agents in a game.
markups: <style="Definition">Goals that are shared by two or more agents in a game.</style>
Players or agents in games nearly always have goals that they try to reach. When two or more share goals for some reason these goals are <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style>.

Members of teams in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Sports">Sports</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ice%20Hockey">Ice Hockey</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Soccer">Soccer</link></style> have the <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> of beating the other team. Likewise, players in computer-based games such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Defense%20of%20the%20Ancients">Defense of the Ancients</link></style>, the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Counter-Strike%20series">Counter-Strike series</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/League%20of%20Legends">League of Legends</link></style> try to work together to beat another team.

Explicit <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> are found in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Co-Op%20Games">Co-Op Games</link></style>. Examples of such games are <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Forbidden%20Island">Forbidden Island</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ghost%20Stories">Ghost Stories</link></style>, the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Left%204%20Dead%20series">Left 4 Dead series</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Legendary:%20A%20Marvel%20Deck%20Building%20Game">Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Pandemic">Pandemic</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Yggdrasil">Yggdrasil</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> are typically used to provide players with <style="Link"><link="shared-rewards">Shared Rewards</link></style> and/or <style="Link"><link="shared-penalties">Shared Penalties</link></style> for some activity, and if <style="Link"><link="agents">Agents</link></style> shared those goals create <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style>. Another reason is to make <style="Link"><link="algorithmic-agents">Algorithmic Agents</link></style> into <style="Link"><link="companions">Companions</link></style> by giving them <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> with a player. A third, diegetic or narrative, reason is that the goals of some in a <style="Link"><link="factions">Faction</link></style> logically make them <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> for the <style="Link"><link="factions">Faction</link></style> as a whole. Related to this, <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> can be used to create <style="Link"><link="social-dilemmas">Social Dilemmas</link></style> when combined with <style="Link"><link="internal-rivalry">Internal Rivalry</link></style>. The goal of <style="Link"><link="team-elimination">Team Elimination</link></style> for another team is a <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goal</style> for members of that other team, and <style="Link"><link="beat-leader">Beat the Leader</link></style> is a <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goal</style> for all players of a game instance except the (perceived) leader. However, providing players with <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> can be a way to temper what would otherwise be a harsh <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Competition">Competition</link></style>. A special case of <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> is those that players together decide upon, i.e. the ones that are <style="Link"><link="player-defined-goals">Player-Defined Goals</link></style>; these can occur spontaneously within game instances whenever players can identify some form of <style="Link"><link="shared-rewards">Shared Rewards</link></style> (or <style="Link"><link="shared-penalties">Shared Penalties</link></style> they want to avoid). <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> which players are forced to chose but they still have possibilities to affect the specifics of, that is they are <style="Link"><link="player-defined-goals">Player-Defined Goals</link></style> bound by rules, can require or demand that the players engage in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Negotiation">Negotiation</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> can be modified in several different ways. <style="Link"><link="individual-penalties">Individual Penalties</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="individual-rewards">Individual Rewards</link></style> can be added, as can <style="Link"><link="asymmetric-resource-distribution">Asymmetric Resource Distribution</link></style> in general, to make the incentives for players to reach the <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> differ. Having <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Secret%20Alliances">Secret Alliances</link></style> make <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Collaboration">Collaboration</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="cooperation">Cooperation</link></style> regarding the goals much more difficult. Be able to, or having to, engage in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Negotiation">Negotiation</link></style> adds a social or diplomatic dimension to <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style>. This can either be in relation to completing the goals - for example by being given <style="Link"><link="shared-resources">Shared Resources</link></style> when being given the <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> - or due to the fact that the <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="penalties">Penalties</link></style> are given out according to <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Player-Decided%20Distributions">Player-Decided Distributions</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="betrayal">Betrayal</link></style> introduces uncertainty of how much players can rely on each other in wanting to actually reach the now-not-completely <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style>.

Quite naturally, the <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> players have with each other cannot be <style="Link"><link="incompatible-goals">Incompatible Goals</link></style>. It is also difficult to have <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> over that which one has <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Conflicts">Conflicts</link></style> regarding.

That <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> most often provide <style="Link"><link="shared-rewards">Shared Rewards</link></style> can give rise to <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Alliances">Alliances</link></style> if those sharing the goals are not already in <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="cooperation">Cooperation</link></style> as well as <style="Link"><link="symbiotic-player-relations">Symbiotic Player Relations</link></style> in both cases. This also modifies how players view the <style="Link"><link="penalties">Penalties</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style> they would each get compared to receiving them but knowing that nobody else receive any. <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> are by definition <style="Link"><link="symmetric-goals">Symmetric Goals</link></style> and succeeding with them are often <style="Link"><link="team-accomplishments">Team Accomplishments</link></style>. In <style="Link"><link="multiplayer-games">Multiplayer Games</link></style> where <style="Link"><link="fubar-enjoyment">FUBAR Enjoyment</link></style> is possible, the presence of <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> can make this turn into <style="Link"><link="mutual-fubar-enjoyment">Mutual FUBAR Enjoyment</link></style>.

While giving players <style="Link"><link="shared-resources">Shared Resources</link></style> to handle <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> affect who players try to do this, giving <style="CurrentLink">Mutual Goals</style> to players that already have <style="Link"><link="shared-resources">Shared Resources</link></style> naturally affect how they treat these <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style>.

<style="Link"><link="asymmetric-resource-distribution">Asymmetric Resource Distribution</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="betrayal">Betrayal</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="individual-penalties">Individual Penalties</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="individual-rewards">Individual Rewards</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Negotiation">Negotiation</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="player-defined-goals">Player-Defined Goals</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Player-Decided%20Distributions">Player-Decided Distributions</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Secret%20Alliances">Secret Alliances</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="shared-resources">Shared Resources</link></style>
